page.title: 10THORNBRIDGE HALL
page.content: {Thornbridge Hall }was built on land once owned by the Longsdon family of Great Longstone. A Mr. Marples had the House altered in the early 1900's, the grounds alone costing Â£20,000 to lay out. A later owner Mr. Boot was famous for his collection of statues in the grounds. In the second world war the building was used as a School and later the buildings were used as a Teacher Training College. In 1971 the College merged with Totley College of Education and in 1974 the site became an Educational Field Study Centre for the use of Sheffield Schools. The buildings are now used as a Conference Centre by Sheffield City Council and the grounds remain available to Sheffield Schools for camping and field studies.
